name: Hotel Indigo London-Paddington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights at the Hotel Indigo last weekend and found it excellent. The room was extremely nice, all newly renovated with very trendy features and a stylish bathroom. Can't comment on the breakfast as this was not included in the price of room, but overall was an perfect stay. The only problem I had was the noise coming from the road, but if you're lucky enough to have a room facing the back of the hotel, should be much quieter.
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel
Excellent!
reviews.text: Also - very small detail here - bring a shower cap if you want to have a shower without washing your hair... Their shower is an unmissable feature but they don't supply shower caps with their complimentary toiletries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location too! Just a few minutes walk from the tube station and plenty of restaurants in the area if you are too lazy/tired to go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Nice Little Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful and newly renovated hotel ohh so close to Paddington (and therefore Heathrow Express) with great and attentive staff (mainly - but a couple of exceptions). Carefully thought out, reasonably affordable (for London).I am hard to please but this one certainly does so, and with aplomb. I will stay again and would recommend it to all.All in all, fab! Nearby is Chinese restaurant MaxiMini, also very much worth a visit especially as Jimmy Choo is a partner in it and we ended up having a long and most enjoyable chat with the great man himself.
reviews.title: Location and design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Indigo was a great little place to stay during our first whirlwind (4 day) trip to London. It is ideally located a block from Paddington Station which makes it easy to get to from Heathrow using the Heathrow Express. It also makes for easy access to the rail and Tube for getting around the rest of London. The Paddington area isn't as nice as some areas of London but we still felt safe walking around even in the evenings. The hotel rooms are not huge by any means but are very clean, have all the basics and are very smartly designed and decorated. The only downside really was that they pump in a vanilla scent into the lobby which while my wife liked made me sneeze like crazy (I actually had to take allergy medicine to keep it under control), but this may not bother other people. The staff were friendly and always smiled and said hello whenever we came and went. We didn't eat at the Phi restaurant in the hotel, but it looked well managed. There are several great places to eat in the nearby area which are cheaper options (for breakfast try Mimo's Cafe next door and for a very nice locals style pub try Victoria's just down the road on Sussex Pl.) The only other con is that recently the prices have seemed to have climbed rather high, in the past I would have rated the hotel a good value, now I would only give it an ok value rating, but overall this is a great place to stay.
reviews.title: VERY BAD! Not reliable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our group of 9 had four rooms at the Indigo. Three were quite small and one was larger. However, we all loved this hotel despite the size of the room. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was a good size. The hotel provided free soft drinks and free Wi-Fi. The location was great. Just one block from Paddington Station where you could get the Heathrow Express and three tube lines. There are several small parks near the hotel where you can rest and enjoy some fresh air. The excellent "hop on, hop off" bus stops right across the street. Other reviewers complained about the breakfast, but we all found it adequate with many choices. The staff at this hotel is great, especially Tamara who worked in the restaurant at breakfast and at the front desk. She was extremely friendly and provided great information. We could not have been more pleased.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Indigo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is just a 3 minute walk from Paddington Station with compact yet very efficient an well appointed amenities.
reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable and the separate work area had multiple outlets which was very convenient.
reviews.title: Loved the Indigo
Unique hotel in the Paddington area
reviews.text: The shower is equipped with both a large rain shower heard as well as a strong hand unit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free drinks in the mini bar was a unexpected pleasant suprise.
reviews.title: Handy to the station - rooms a little small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Indigo has well laid-out rooms and great design quality. Despite being "London-size" hotel rooms, it was a very functional space with nice furniture, colors, and fixtures. My only compliant was a slow shower drain, but that's minor! We used Paddington station every day and I can't emphasize enough; it is very convenient - so much so that it removes an element of stress to arrival and departure.
reviews.title: Cool Rooms, Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is excellently located, very close to Paddington and Hyde Park. Staff was helpful. The rooms were spacious and first class all the way. All amenities, nice beds, wonderful shower. Lots of restaurants nearby. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel; great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here on business & really liked the place. Easy walk to Paddington Station & tube on the corner, so really easy to get about London.
reviews.title: Nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the best of areas & few dodgy looking people outside but the hotel itself is clean, modern & stylish with good levels of service. I prefer the Tower Hill Indego, but this made a nice change.
reviews.title: What was a brilliant hotel is now tired and expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been staying at the Hotel Indigo for a number of years now mainly due to the position (within walking distance of Paddington and therefore LHR), its value for money and contemporary feel. My latest stay was for one night when my husband arrived prior to us departing to Berlin.
reviews.title: Nice value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: 5 minutes walk from Paddington station so very handy for Heathrow Express. The hotel has a design flowing though that reflects the local area so makes a change from a typical branded hotel . Wifi is free and the food is 'modern British'. The bed is very comfortable - rooms are small but have all you need
reviews.title: Handy for Paddington and has s nice character to it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've just spent 3 days in London, with my sister. Hotel Indigo is literally a block from Paddington station, which made our travels seamless combining the Heathrow express with a block to walk. I'll recommend it to any one.
reviews.title: Painless in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: It is a short walk to Kensington gardens and the red line, which adds another option for city travel.
reviews.title: Good and bad, not sure I'll stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel staff were superb, between Margaret and Mario, we were informed of some excellent restaurants, ideal routes to travel to destinations etc. Their friendliness and expert knowledge made our short holiday even easier.
reviews.title: Great Location Near Paddington, Tiny Room, Not Best Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Initially I was a bit surprised to get be assigned to a "basement" room, but it was very quiet, apparently slightly larger than the other rooms and it was really comfortable. I will easily return on my next stay.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Indigo
reviews.title: Liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent the 2009 summer here -June 28-July 3! LOL
reviews.title: An awesome upgrade!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It fitted our criteria -
reviews.title: An oasis of calm and luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A/C-really needed it that week,
reviews.title: The Indigo hotel was exceptionally clean with an outstanding and courteous staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gym with exercise bikes-my husband was in training for a bicycle tour
reviews.title: Feel good factor. No disappointments.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend 4 nights in this hotel and we must see, that this hotel is very nice to stay in. The room was very nice, nice, but cold, bathroom. Clean rooms and very nice staff.
reviews.title: A great and nice hotel for your visit to Londen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: It is very difficult to find a good, reasonably-priced hotel in London but I think I have finally found it. Hotel Indigo was fantastic - very modern, incredibly clean, very friendly staff, great breakfast, reasonable rates (I think I paid about UK 129 pounds which is good for London), and great location next to Paddington. And, rather unusually for a hotel, I was able to OPEN THE WINDOW AND GET SOME FRESH AIR! I loved that (after a 24 hour flight from Australia that was wonderful). All I could ask for really. Only downside? Possibly the size of the room which was rather small, but to be honest this is the norm for London so I didn't mind that. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in - modern, clean and fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say i could not fault this hotel - great location, lovely friendly helpful staff, spotlessly clean & comfortable bed. We arrived for early check in & the staff were more than accomodating. I would say the only disadvantage was that we were located a room in the basement which inturn we had no mobile phone reception but to be honest we didnt mind.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff made an evening call to ensure everything was ok & to see if we needed any extra towels etc.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: On going to a show at the Westend the kind receptionist printed us out a map with directions...very kind.
reviews.title: Beds are great-high and hard, Full English Breakfast is Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again a lovely stay! My favourite of all the Hoilday Inn group, check-in was quick and efficient. Rooms are very well appointed, however small. We wouldn't want a 4th floor room again as headroom is an issue. Great internal decked court terrace, handy for all smokers. Used rewards points for this stay and glad we used them wisely at this little gem.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Traveling for business means staying in hotels often. The Hotel Indigo ranks as one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Incredibly clean and modern with many nice touches (awesome shower, a complimentary stocked fridge, free wi-fi, etc). I came back to my room in the evening and the bed was turned down, with a chocolate on the pillow and a nice note saying that there was a gift for me in the fridge...a fine dessert. The staff were extremely helpful and hospitable. And to top it off, the hotel is only steps away from Paddington. This will continue to be my hotel of choice while staying in London.
reviews.title: Absolutely excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was my second visit to this establishment. Right next to the Paddington station the location couldn't be any better. You get the (non alcoholic) beverages for free. You get a very comfortable bed. You get a great flat screen tv right in front of you. And you get an excellent shower. The staff was friendly enough. Again, I had a great night's stay at Indigo Paddington.
reviews.title: The room is tiny but well compensated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was my second stay and it exceeded my first. I traveled with a friend and we were assigned a room in the basement. It was amazing. Light streamed in from the courtyard, The room was very large by any standards. It contained two single beds, two end tables, two chairs, a large screen TV, a desk with chair, small closet, safe, makeup mirror, hairdryer, two bathrobes, two pair of slippers and a dish of candy. Our small frig contained complementary water, lemonade and soda. Because of the location is was blessedly quiet. The bathroom was immense and that is when we discovered that it was a handicapped room. The bathroom even had a towel warmer. There were ample towels.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The only negative I can share is that the attached restaurant did not provide a full service bar. Maybe this is the case in London, but they were unable to make a mixed drink, only beer, wine and shots. They did try to make a vodka and tonic but instead of tonic the used a product called Slimline and it was truly vile. We ordered a Margarita pizza and were served a cheese pizza with a thin plywood crust (no basil or fresh tomato) and it appeared uncut. We we told that in London all pizza is served uncut! That would not have been a problem if they provided a chain saw to get through the crust. Still, there were plenty of dining options.
reviews.title: Second stay as great as the first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: beautiful hotel, excellent room, superb staff!
reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: will go again!!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Could not fault this hotel - great location, lovely friendly helpful staff, spotlessly clean, comfortable bed.... everything you could hope for. Loved it so much that I intend to stay there again next week!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only down side was that the room service menu was not operable after 10pm but I found a mass selection of fast food joints just around the corner to stem my hunger!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel's lobby is very small and not very nice. But the room is nicer but very small. I liked the bathroom but the white plastic floor in the shower is cheap and ugly and don't fit the rest of the bathroom which is nice. The design of room and furniture is ok. Bed was very good. Internet is free (only WiFI) and fast. I would rate this hotel 2 - 3 star not more. Location is very good if you come by train from Heathrow airport. Check in was slow and I missed a "welcome". The lady in reception was in a bad mood and was not helpful. The food from the roomservice was avarage. Room was expensive even at discounted rate. Next time I will try other hotel in London.
reviews.title: Artsy boutique hotel--but comfortable, clean, and great location

description: Upon entering Hotel Indigo London-Paddington you feel an immediate shift away from the hectic pace of business travel. Enjoy the quiet luxury and individuality of this chic, London boutique hotel moments from Paddington Station. Hotel Indigo London-Paddington benefits from the central Paddington location which is a tourist hub and a home to many business headquarters. This boutique hotel is adjacent to Paddington Station from where the Heathrow Express leaves every 15 minutes and takes the same time to reach the airport. Preferred equally by business executives and leisure guests, the Hotel Indigo London-Paddington is close to Oxford Street shops and Selfridge's, beautiful Hyde Park and Notting Hill areas. It is easy to reach the City, West End theatres or the famous galleries and museums from Paddington Station.
